tourBios.carHigh:
Played NGA Tour and eGolf Tour in 2011-2013. Had not played in a Web.com Tour tournament prior to 2014 season.

2013: Finished second on the NGA Tour Pro Series and NGA Tour Carolina Summer series money lists. Won two tournaments, had two runners-up, one third, two fourths and a fifth-place showing...Played in his first PGA TOUR event, the Reno-Tahoe Open, on a sponsor exemption (missed cut)...Finished second at the second stage Web.com Tour Qualifying Tournament at Gautier, Miss., to advance to Finals and secure his 2014 Tour card.
tourBios.otherCarHigh: Won 16 college tournaments at Malone University in Ohio. Was a four-time NAIA All-American there (first-team three times and third-team once). Played on 2010 NAIA national champion team. Named winner of both Jack Nicklaus Award and Arnold Palmer Award in 2010 (NAIA categories). Also earned the 2011 David Toms Award, which goes to the collegiate player who has overcome adversity to achieve excellence and is presented by Toms' Foundation in conjunction with the College Coaches Association of America.
tourBios.personal: Attended Northwest High School in Fulton, Ohio...If not a professional golfer, would work to become a college athletic director...Younger brother, Chris (age 10), and father, Tim, died in 2005 auto accident...Biggest golf thrill was playing in his first PGA TOUR event (missed cut)...Biggest thrill outside golf was graduating from college...Favorite course played is Mauna Kea in Hawaii...Lucky charms are two ball markers that say "Dad, Chris, 3-26-05."...Favorite TV shows include "Suits" and "Entourage" and favorite movies are "The Dark Horse, "Major League," "Caddyshack" and "Dumb & Dumber."...Favorite entertainers are Luke Bryan and Carrie Underwood...Favorite book is Hunger Games...Favorite athletes are LeBron James, Alex Morgan and Andy Murray...Favorite teams are Ohio State and the three Cleveland teams; the Indians, Cavaliers and Browns...Favorite cities are Charlotte and Columbus...Favorite vacation spot is Maui, Hawaii...Would like to trade places for a day with Carrie Underwood's husband ("Need I say more?")...Has a passion for history...First-tee entrance song would be "Eye of the Tiger."...Twitter name is @justinlower_1.

tourBios.carHigh:
Played NGA Tour and eGolf Tour in 2011-2013. Had not played in a Web.com Tour tournament prior to 2014 season.

2014: Aced the 16th hole at the Cleveland Open in the opening round in front of the home town crowd. Used an 8-iron from 151 yards. Posted a 69 and went on to finish the tournament T55...In late-May, received an invitation to play in Jack Nicklaus' Memorial Tournament in his native Ohio. Missed the cut...Started the final round of the BMW Charity Pro-Am tied for 34th. Fired a bogey-free 64 Sunday and moved to T9.

2013: Finished second on the NGA Tour Pro Series and NGA Tour Carolina Summer series money lists. Won two tournaments, had two runners-up, one third, two fourths and a fifth-place showing...Played in his first PGA TOUR event, the Reno-Tahoe Open, on a sponsor exemption (missed cut)...Finished second at the second stage Web.com Tour Qualifying Tournament at Gautier, Miss., to advance to Finals and secure his 2014 Tour card.

Played on 2010 NAIA national champion team. Named both Jack Nicklaus Award and Arnold Palmer Award winners in 2010. Also earned the 2011 David Toms Award, which goes to the collegiate player who has overcome adversity to achieve excellence and is presented by Toms' Foundation in conjunction with the College Coaches Association of America.

dyn.dynResults: His best finish on the Web.com Tour in 2016 is T20th at the Chitimacha Louisiana Open presented by NACHER.
dyn.dynStats: He ranks T9th in Scoring Average (Actual) on the Web.com Tour.
